tit.cmt: 英語(日本語）併記にしました。

sen.j: 石刃技法（せきじんぎほう）とは、後期旧石器時代に出現し、同時代を特徴づける縦長剥片の剥離技術のこと。
sen.e: Sekijin-giho is the technique of removing vertically-long lithic flakes from stone that emerged during upper Palaeolithic Period and featured the period.
The blade technique is a technique of removing vertically-long lithic flakes from stone, which emerged during the upper Paleolithic period and characterizes the period.
sen.cmt: upper Paleolithic Period →the upper Paleolithic period 'features,' →'characterize'
sen.e: The blade technique is a technique of removing vertically-long lithic flakes from stone, which emerged during the upper Paleolithic period and characterizes the period.

sen.j: これにより、同じ規格の石器の剥片の量産が可能となった。
sen.e: This technique enabled lithic flakes to be standardized and mass-produced.
This technique enabled lithic flakes to be standardized and mass-produced.
This technique enabled lithic flakes to be standardized and mass-produced.

sen.j: 日本においては約3万年前から約1万5,000年前頃にかけてナイフ形石器と歩調を合わせて発達した技法である。
sen.e: In Japan it was developed between about 30 thousand years ago and 15 thousand years ago along with knife-like flint tools.
In Japan it was developed from about 30 thousand years to 15 thousand years ago along with knife-like flint tools.
sen.cmt: ナイフ形石器：knife-like flint toolsとしました。between about 30 thousand years ago and 15 thousand years ago→from about 30 thousand years to 15 thousand years ago
sen.e: In Japan it was developed from about 30 thousand years to 15 thousand years ago along with knife-like flint tools.

sen.j: また、東北アジアの後期旧石器時代の開始を告げる技術的指標である。
sen.e: It is a technical indicator that marks the start of upper Palaeolithic Period in North East Asia.
It is a technical indicator that marks the beginning of the upper Paleolithic period in North East Asia.
It is a technical indicator that marks the beginning of the upper Paleolithic period in North East Asia.

sen.j: この石刃技法は、ユーラシア大陸西部からアルタイ、シベリア経由で東方アジアに広がった革新的技術の一つとみられている。
sen.e: Sekijin-giho is considered as one of innovative techniques that spread from the Eurasian Continent to eastern Asia by way of Altai and Siberia.
The blade technique is considered as one of the innovative techniques that spread from the Eurasian continent to eastern Asia by way of Altai and Siberia.

sen.j: 石刃技法は、人類の進化ホモ・サピエンスの拡散を考える上で重要な要素と考えられている。
sen.e: Sekijin-giho is thought to be an important factor in the study of human evolution and spreading of Homo sapiens.
The blade technique is thought to be an important factor in the research of human evolution and spread of Homo sapiens.
The blade technique is thought to be an important factor in the research of human evolution and spread of Homo sapiens.

sen.j: まず、原石（母岩石材）を輪切り状に大きく荒割りして打面を準備し、石核の素材をつくり出したのちに調整加工を加えて石核を作り、これを連続的に同一方向から加撃してほぼ同じ大きさの縦長剥片を打ちはがしていく。
sen.e: At first raw stone (base rock material) is cracked roughly into round slices to prepare preform of lithic core, which is reduced to lithic core by fixing and processing, and it is struck continuously from the same direction to remove same-sized vertical lithic flakes from the core.

At first, a raw stone (base rock material) is cracked roughly into round slices to prepare the platform of lithic core, then this raw material is reduce and process to a lithic core, which is struck consistently from the same direction to remove the same-sized vertical lithic flakes from the core.
sen.cmt: 構文を若干変えました。preform→platform
sen.e: First, a raw stone (base rock material) is cracked roughly into round slices to prepare the preform for the lithic core, after which the raw material is processed to form a lithic core, which is then struck consistently from the same direction to remove all same-sized vertical lithic flakes from the core.

sen.j: この剥片を刃器（石刃）とよび、二次加工を加えて多様な形態の石器を製作していく。
sen.e: These lithic flakes are called flint blade, which are secondary processed into a variety of stone tools.
These lithic flakes are called flint blade, which are secondarily processed into a variety of stone tools.
These lithic flakes are called flint blade, which are secondarily processed into a variety of stone tools.

sen.j: 二次加工としては刃潰し剥離がなされナイフ形石器を製作することが多かった。
sen.e: Most of the secondary processing was to take the edge off and reduce them to shape knife-like stone tools.
Most of the secondary processing was to take the edge off by smashing and reduce them to knife-like flint tools.
sen.cmt: 刃潰し剥離： to take the edge off by smashing としましたが、術語と思われます。
sen.e: Most of the secondary processing was to take the edge off by smashing and reduce them to knife-like flint tools.
